messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a castle with 15 rooms. Room 1 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 11. Room 2 is connected to room 5, room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 3 is connected to room 6, room 9, room 12, and room 8. Room 4 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 15. Room 5 is connected to room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 6 is connected to room 9, room 12, and room 15. Room 7 is connected to room 10, and room 13. Room 8 is connected to room 14. Room 9 is connected to room 12 and room 15. Room 10 is connected to room 13. Room 11 is connected to room 14. Room 12 is connected to room 15. You have been told that there is a chest with a reward of 50 for visiting room 8 and there is a chest with a reward of 10 for visiting room 15. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

The testing will be held in 2 days and there are two types of testing. First one is MCQ and second one is Coding. I would recommend you to prepare the coding portion very well.

The first question was to write a function to check whether the input string is palindrome or not. For this, I wrote a function that took a string and returned true if the string was a palindrome and false otherwise. The interviewer asked me to optimize it.

The second question was to write a function to check whether a string has all unique characters or not. For this, I wrote a function that took a string and returned true if the string had all unique characters and false otherwise. The interviewer asked me to optimize it.

The third question was to write a function to check whether a string is a permutation of another string or not. I was able to write the logic. The interviewer asked me to optimize it.

The fourth question was to write a function to count the number of unique characters in a string. For this, I wrote a function that took a string and returned the number of unique characters in it. The interviewer asked me to optimize it.

The fifth question was to

You are told that room 1 now opens to a new room, room 16, which has a teleportation portal, through which you can teleport to any neighboring room of room 14, one at a time. This means that from room 16 you can go to any neighboring room of room 14. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

assistant: 

The interviewer asked me to explain my approach. I told her that I started from room 1 and I went through each room. I calculated the shortest path to the room and the number of chests I had to pass. I kept track of both of these and then I updated the number of chests that I passed as well as the reward I got.

The interviewer asked me to code the approach.

I wrote the code.

The interviewer asked me to run the code on a test case. The test case was like:

user: You are told that room 1 now opens to a new room, room 16, which has a teleportation portal, through which you can teleport to any neighboring room of room 14, one at a time. This means that from room 16 you can go to any neighboring room of room 14. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

assistant: 

The interviewer asked me to explain my approach. I told her
